page.title: 13CHALFONT AREA MEDIA
page.content: We visited THE BUCKINGHAMSHIRE ADVERTISER and asked the {editor} "What hit the headlines the most?" He said," Accidents, car-crashes or unusual happenings like someone falling off a roof and dying." His most interesting piece of news was when a gipsy baby was killed in an accident and dumped in a field. {Disasters} and {accidents} make the most interesting news items. I asked him how many {newspapers} he printed in a week and he replied, "9000". About 75% of the population of Chalfont St. Peter receive the local paper which is published weekly on Wednesdays.
